description:
Position Summary

We are looking for you - dynamic, best-in-class talent - to join the IPG Mediabrands team. As an entry level associate you will create, innovate, and guide our processes. This entry-level opportunity will kick-start your career in media and provide a platform to partner with the world’s leading consumer brands.

A proven entity in helping clients maximize business results through integrated, intelligence-driven marketing strategies, IPG Mediabrands is committed to driving automated buying, pay-for-performance and digital innovation solutions through its network of media agencies including Universal McCann, Initiative, BPN, Orion Holdings, and ID Media. Its roster of specialty service agencies including MAGNA GLOBAL, Mediabrands Audience Platform, Mediabrands Publishing, IPG Media Lab, Ensemble, and Identity offer technologies and industry moving partnerships that are recognized for delivering unprecedented bottom line results for clients. 

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Assistant Media Planner:

  • Help build a media plan; work closely with consumer and media strategists, and investment specialists to develop holistic communications plan.
  • Use qualitative and quantitative research to develop consumer insights, role of channel, budget allocations, and begin to develop analytical skills.
  • Compile research and competitive data that will be submitted to planning teams and clients to ensure client is reaching target audience.
  • Learn to utilize syndicated sources/programs and master basic media math.
  • Develop tactical components of client media campaigns, such as flow charts, spreadsheets and budget summaries.
  • Work collaboratively with Planners at all levels to craft RFPs and brief Investment teams on insights and strategies.
  • Oversee and coordinate resolution of billing and discrepancies within designated timeframe.
  • Participate in team brainstorming sessions.
  • Handle day-to-day client requests.

 

Assistant Media Buyer:

  • Develop a working knowledge of client’s goals, guidelines and strategies.
  • Assist in inputting buys and pulling system reports.
  • Efficiently manage the posting process by both analyzing and monitoring network schedules and performances.
  • Review with buyer(s) all billing discrepancies and resolve in a timely manner.
  • Assist in buying/allocation process.
  • Assist in tracking of buys.
  • Compile research and competitive data to submit to planning teams and clients to ensure client is reaching target audience.
  • Learn how to develop audience estimates for programming.
  • Handle day-to-day client requests.
  • Set-up and maintain any required reports.

 

QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree required

Work Experience:

  • Previous internship in related field strongly preferred

Skills:

  • Knowledge and passion for media/advertising
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Exceptional organizational skills and multi-tasking capabilities
  • Ability to work well under pressure
  • Strong quantitative skills, including analytical abilities
  • Proficiency at MS Suite: Excel, Word, PowerPoint
  • Ability to be flexible and be a team player
title: Entry-level Media Opportunities
